# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
using Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    # Add a new column with the extracted year and month
    df[:ym] = @. (Year(df.dt):Month(df.dt)) |> string |> parseint
end
```

This function uses the `Year` and `Month` functions from the `Dates` module to extract the year and month from the `dt` column, and then concatenates them together as an integer in format "yyyymm". The `@.` macro is used to broadcast the operations over all rows of the DataFrame.

You can use this function like this:
```julia
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will create a new column `ym` in the `df` DataFrame with the extracted year and month values.
